data.event: The postcode is 2209, which it shares with neighbouring Narwee.
Beverly Hills is mostly residential, consisting of many freestanding red brick and tile bungalows built in the years immediately after World War 2.

event.title: was originally known as Dumbleton after a local farm in the area, circa 1830

data.event: Beverly Hills was originally known as Dumbleton after a local farm in the area, circa 1830.
This name was generally disliked by residents who lobbied to supplant it with a more glamorous alternative to coincide with the arrival of the East Hills railway line, which opened 31 December 1931.
Real estate developments followed in the 1930s and 1940s.
